‚ö†Ô∏è What is recyclable is not necessarily recycled.‚ö†Ô∏è In Brazil, 890 tons of plastic are thrown into the oceans every day. We need to reduce the use of disposable plastic, that's why @ifood @Uber_Brasil and @rappibrasil we want #PlasticFreeDelivery #DeLivreDePlastico
We need concrete action to tackle plastic pollution. That's why we ask @ifood @uber_brasil and @rappibrasil to commit to deliveries free of disposable plastic. #DeLivreDePl√°stico

8 million tonnes of plastic end up in the world‚Äôs oceans every year. How does it get there? A lot of it comes from the world‚Äôs rivers, which serve as direct conduits of trash from the world‚Äôs cities to the marine environment.
Researchers estimate that more than 8.3 billion tonnes of plastic has been produced since the early 1950s. About 60% of that plastic has ended up in either a landfill or the natural environment.
How did we get here?

We have become addicted to single-use or disposable plastic ‚Äî with severe environmental consequences. Half of all plastic produced is designed to be used only once ‚Äî and then thrown away. #DeLivreDePl√°stico
Our planet is drowning in plastic pollution‚Äîit's time for change! #DeLivreDePl√°stico #FreeFromPlastic

Who can register and organize a strike?
Everyone!
Individuals, big or small groups, every action countsüåçüåèüåé  (9/10)

Do you feel your security is at risk?
We are a peaceful organization, but we have seen cases of counter protestors, so please take care to prioritize your safety.

Use #ARZ_helps if a minor human rights violation occurs and you would like to raise awareness.   (8/10)

Why should I register my strike?
It makes groups easier to be recognized by individuals, press and media people interested in being involved. (7/10)

If you know someone in your city organizing a strike, reach out so you can be part of their actions, if you are unsure head to: https://t.co/SHqZ2zsWni to check out some countries and local groups leading actions. (6/10)

How can I register my strike? üíª
Fill the form available at https://t.co/HbDGx2F8ia
Be sure to be as accurate as possible! (5/10)

I can't join a strike because of covid: 
You can join a digital strike by posting a picture with a message on social media, or by using our hashtag everywhere #UprootTheSystem.
get creative, the sky's the limit. (4/10)

Do you need resources? üëÄ
Check out: https://t.co/jOxWyohFGk
You will find our logo, tips, chants and more! (3/10)

Start Small!
You can strike on your own, but it is often more fun and more productive to get some friends together. Decide on a time and place to strike and invite members of local climate justice groups and environmental groups.  ‚úä
The more people the better! (2/10)

MAPA the most impacted by the climate crisis and yet the less contributors are beign directly affected. 

Globally, approximately 1 billion children (nearly half of the world's children) live in extremely high-risk countries.

The highest-risk places on Earth contribute least to the causes of climate change ‚Äì the 33 extremely high-risk countries emit less than 10 per cent of global
greenhouse gas emissions.

The 10 most extremely high-risk countries emit only 0.5 per cent of global emissions.

On Map 1 (Yellow & orange) we can see how Climate and Environmental Hazards, Shocks and Stresses overlap around the world.
And on Map 2 (purple) we can see the current climate risk countries around the world. 

Access to the interactive data atlas: https://t.co/PP8FlMMeIr https://t.co/IDABIO2hyB

Children are more vulnerable to climate and environmental shocks than adults for several reasons:
-Physically  & physiologically more vulnerable.
-More at risk of death compared with adults from diseases likely exacerbated by climate change

820 million children are currently highly exposed to heatwaves. 400 million are currently highly exposed to cyclones. 920 million are currently highly exposed to water scarcity. And 2 billion are exposed to air pollution.
The climate crisis is the defining human and child‚Äôs rights challenge of this generation, and is already having a devastating impact on the well-being of children globally.
